snippet: Michel Djotodia, a wily opportunist who conducted a coup d’état in the Central African Republic in March, continues to hold the presidency, despite an international outcry.
abstract: Political intentions of Central African Republic's self-proclaimed president Michel Djotodia remain unclear, as do circumstances surrounding his rise to power in late March coup.

byline.contributor: Benno Muchler contributed reporting from Bangui, Central African Republic.

lead_paragraph: Michel Djotodia, a wily opportunist who conducted a coup d’état in the Central African Republic in March, continues to hold the presidency, despite an international outcry.

headline.seo: Michel Djotodia, Leader of Coup in Central African Republic, Holds On to Power
headline.main: Mystery Shrouds Rise and Aims of Rebel at Helm of Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: Mystery Shrouds Rise and Aims of Rebel at Helm of Central African Republic

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
